intro: Brassica laevigata, commonly known as the smooth mustard, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is characterized by its yellow flowers and smooth, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and prefers well-drained soils. It produces small, round pods containing seeds that are used in traditional medicine and as a spice. Brassica laevigata is also valued for its role in ecological systems, supporting pollinators and serving as a host plant for certain insects.
